intro: Tabernaemontana flavescens, commonly known as the yellow star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or coastal areas. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
